journeys.title: Breaking Harmful Conflict Patterns
journeys.summary: Missions to help you stop the same fight from repeating and build calmer ways to disagree.

milestones.title: Your streak starts
milestones.message: You took your first step. Keep going tomorrow.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are building healthier habits in your home.

milestones.title: Journey complete
milestones.message: You finished strong. Keep practicing what works.

missions.title: Notice Your Conflict Pattern
missions.subtitle: Catch your default reaction when tension starts.
missions.whyThisMatters: You can’t change what you don’t notice. This mission helps you catch your pattern before it takes over.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Today, notice your first reaction when tension starts.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: When you feel tension, pause for 3 seconds.
Pick what you usually do first: snap, defend, shut down, walk away, go quiet.
Say one sentence to your spouse: “I’m getting tense. I want to handle this well.”

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Your goal is not to solve the issue today. Your goal is to catch your pattern early.

completionCard.title: You caught it early
completionCard.message: Noticing your pattern is the first win.

missions.title: Remove “Always” and “Never”
missions.subtitle: Speak without attacking your spouse’s character.
missions.whyThisMatters: Words like “always” and “never” turn one issue into a personal attack. Removing them lowers the heat fast.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: In your next tense talk, do not use “always” or “never.”
If you catch yourself, stop and restart your sentence.
Replace it with: “Today” or “This week.”

cards.title: Examples
bullets: Instead of “You always ignore me,” say “Today I felt ignored.”
Instead of “You never help,” say “This week I felt alone with it.”

completionCard.title: You kept it fair
completionCard.message: You addressed the issue without attacking your spouse.

missions.title: Talk About One Issue Only
missions.subtitle: Keep the conversation safe by staying on one topic.
missions.whyThisMatters: Many fights explode because one issue becomes five issues. One issue keeps your talk clear.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one topic only (money, chores, time, intimacy, parenting, in-laws).
Set a 5-minute timer.
Rule: no old stories, no name-calling, no extra topics.
Each person says: “What I feel is ___.” then “What I need is ___.”

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: If a new topic shows up, say: “Let’s park that and finish this one.”

completionCard.title: You kept it simple
completionCard.message: One topic made the talk safer and clearer.

missions.title: Take a Break the Right Way
missions.subtitle: Step away without disappearing or punishing.
missions.whyThisMatters: A break can calm you down, but disappearing makes things worse. This mission teaches a safe break.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: When you feel overwhelmed, say: “I need 10 minutes. I will come back.”
Take your 10 minutes (breathe, pray, drink water).
Come back and say: “I’m ready to continue.”

cards.title: Rule
cards.text: A break is not silent treatment. You must return.

completionCard.title: You returned
completionCard.message: You calmed down and came back. That builds trust.

missions.title: Own Your Part
missions.subtitle: Say one sentence that admits your part—no excuses.
missions.whyThisMatters: Owning your part stops power struggles and opens the door to peace.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Say one sentence: “You’re right—I ______.” or “I shouldn’t have ______.”
Stop after one sentence.
Do not add “but”.

cards.title: Examples
bullets: “You’re right—I raised my voice.”
“I shouldn’t have dismissed you.”

completionCard.title: You chose humility
completionCard.message: That one sentence lowered the heat.

missions.title: Replace Blame With a Need
missions.subtitle: Say what you need instead of what your spouse did wrong.
missions.whyThisMatters: Blame makes your spouse defensive. Needs make your message clear.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one blame sentence you say often.
Say it again as a need:
Use: “I need ______” or “It would help me if ______.”

cards.title: Examples
bullets: Instead of “You don’t care,” say “I need you to listen for 2 minutes.”
Instead of “You ignore me,” say “It would help me if we talk after dinner.”

completionCard.title: You became clear
completionCard.message: You asked for what you need without attacking your spouse.

missions.title: Use a Low Voice
missions.subtitle: Lower your voice even if you feel hot inside.
missions.whyThisMatters: A low voice reduces escalation and protects respect in your home.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: In your next tense moment, lower your voice on purpose.
If you notice your voice rising, stop and say: “Let me say that calmly.”
Repeat your sentence with a lower voice.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Slow down your words. Slow words help calm your body.

completionCard.title: You kept your respect
completionCard.message: Your low voice protected the conversation.

missions.title: Finish the Conversation
missions.subtitle: Don’t leave things hanging for days.
missions.whyThisMatters: Leaving fights unfinished creates anxiety and distance. Finishing the talk builds safety.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one unfinished issue from this week.
Set a 10-minute time to talk today.
End with one decision: “We will do ______” OR “We will revisit this on ______.”

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: A simple plan is better than a perfect plan.

completionCard.title: You closed the loop
completionCard.message: You replaced tension with a clear next step.

missions.title: Reconnect the Same Day
missions.subtitle: Don’t carry tension into tomorrow.
missions.whyThisMatters: Same-day reconnection keeps your marriage safe even when issues aren’t fully solved.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Before bed, say: “I don’t want us to sleep in coldness. Can we reconnect?”
Do one simple ending: hug 10 seconds or hold hands 30 seconds.
Optional: pray one sentence for peace.

completionCard.title: You chose peace
completionCard.message: That small reconnection protects your home.

missions.title: Pick Your New Pattern
missions.subtitle: Choose one new habit for your next 7 days.
missions.whyThisMatters: A one-time win feels good. A habit changes your home.

cards.title: Choose your habit
cards.prompt: Pick one habit for your next 7 days:
options: No “always/never” in our tense talks.
One topic only when we disagree.
If we take a break, we always come back.

cards.title: Tell your spouse
bullets: Say: “For 7 days, I want us to try this.”
Start today.

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You are building calmer habits that last.

journeys.title: Recovering After Hurt or Betrayal
journeys.summary: Serious missions to help you face what happened, speak with honesty, and rebuild safety step by step.

milestones.title: You chose truth
milestones.message: You are becoming a safe place again—one honest step at a time.

milestones.title: You are rebuilding safety
milestones.message: Your spouse is seeing consistency, not excuses.

milestones.title: You stayed consistent
milestones.message: You finished strong. Keep being trustworthy in the small things.

missions.title: Name the Hurt Clearly
missions.subtitle: Acknowledge your spouse’s pain without excuses.
missions.whyThisMatters: Healing can’t start until the hurt is named plainly. This mission starts that process with honesty.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Sit with your spouse. Put phones away.
Say: “I know I hurt you when I ______.”
Then say: “You didn’t deserve that.”
Stop. Listen.

cards.title: Who you are becoming
cards.text: You are becoming a spouse who tells the truth, owns your actions, and protects your marriage.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Do not explain your reasons in this moment. Your job is to acknowledge the pain.

completionCard.title: You acknowledged the pain
completionCard.message: That honesty is the first step toward safety.

missions.title: Listen to the Impact
missions.subtitle: Let your spouse describe how it affected them.
missions.whyThisMatters: When your spouse feels heard, their heart softens. This mission is about listening, not defending.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “Can you tell me how it affected you?”
While they speak: no interrupting, no defending, no correcting.
When they finish, say: “Thank you for telling me.”

cards.title: Rule
cards.text: If you feel defensive, breathe once and keep listening.

completionCard.title: You stayed open
completionCard.message: Listening without defense builds trust.

missions.title: Apologize Without Conditions
missions.subtitle: Say sorry without “but.”
missions.whyThisMatters: A real apology takes responsibility. A conditional apology reopens the wound.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Say: “I’m sorry for ______.”
Then say: “I understand it hurt you.”
Do not add “but.”

cards.title: Rule
cards.text: No “but you…” No “if you…” No excuses.

completionCard.title: You took responsibility
completionCard.message: That is the kind of apology that heals.

missions.title: Answer One Hard Question
missions.subtitle: Answer one question honestly without anger.
missions.whyThisMatters: Honest answers rebuild trust. Angry answers destroy it. This mission trains calm truth.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask your spouse: “What is one question you need answered?”
Listen to the question fully.
Answer honestly in short sentences.
If you need a moment, say: “Give me 2 minutes to answer well.”

completionCard.title: You chose truth
completionCard.message: Truth with calm is powerful.

missions.title: Set One Visible Change
missions.subtitle: Pick one change your spouse can see this week.
missions.whyThisMatters: Words don’t rebuild trust. Consistent actions do. This mission turns talk into proof.

cards.title: Choose your change
cards.prompt: Pick one change your spouse can see this week:
options: I will be where I said I will be.
I will answer calls/messages within a reasonable time.
I will be fully transparent about my plans.
I will stop the behavior that caused the hurt.

cards.title: Your proof matters
cards.text: Trust rebuilds when your spouse sees the same good action again and again.

cards.title: Tell your spouse
bullets: Say your choice out loud.
Ask: “Is this the change you need most right now?”

completionCard.title: You gave proof
completionCard.message: A visible change is a strong step toward safety.

missions.title: Remove Pressure
missions.subtitle: Give your spouse space without rushing them.
missions.whyThisMatters: Rushing healing feels selfish. This mission trains patience and respect.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Say: “I won’t rush you. I will be consistent.”
Ask: “What helps you feel safe today?”
Accept their answer without arguing.

completionCard.title: You chose patience
completionCard.message: Patience is part of rebuilding trust.

missions.title: Do a 3-Minute Check-in
missions.subtitle: Check in daily without pressure.
missions.whyThisMatters: Short, consistent check-ins reduce anxiety and rebuild connection over time.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “How are you feeling about us today?”
Listen for 2 minutes.
Say: “Thank you. I’m here.”
Stop.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Keep it short. This is not a debate. It’s a check-in.

completionCard.title: You showed consistency
completionCard.message: Short check-ins build safety over time.

missions.title: Reconnect the Same Day
missions.subtitle: End the day without coldness.
missions.whyThisMatters: Even in a hard season, reconnection protects your home.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Before bed, say: “I’m sorry this is hard. I’m here.”
Hold hands for 30 seconds or hug for 10 seconds.
Optional: pray one sentence for peace.

completionCard.title: You chose peace
completionCard.message: That small step keeps the door open.

missions.title: Review Your Week of Actions
missions.subtitle: Look back at your consistency together.
missions.whyThisMatters: Healing needs evidence over time. Reviewing actions builds confidence.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “Did I keep my visible change this week?”
Listen to your spouse’s answer.
Say: “Thank you. I will keep going.”

completionCard.title: You stayed accountable
completionCard.message: Accountability builds trust.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Trust Plan
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit that supports your healing.
missions.whyThisMatters: Consistency is the bridge back to trust.

cards.title: Choose your habit
cards.prompt: Pick one habit for your next 7 days:
options: A 3-minute daily check-in.
No defensiveness when my spouse shares pain.
One visible action every day.

cards.title: Tell your spouse
bullets: Say: “For 7 days, I will do this. You will see it.”
Start today.

cards.title: Your simple plan
bullets: Do your chosen habit daily for 7 days.
Every evening, send one short message: “I’m here. I’m staying consistent.”
Once this week, ask: “What helps you feel safer right now?” and listen.

cards.title: Optional prayer
cards.text: God, help me be honest, steady, and loving. Help us heal with time and truth. Amen.

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You chose a plan and you are staying consistent. Keep showing up.

journeys.title: Rebuilding Trust and Reliability
journeys.summary: Practical missions to help you keep your word, communicate clearly, and become dependable again.

milestones.title: Your streak starts
milestones.message: You took your first step. Keep going tomorrow.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are building healthier habits in your home.

milestones.title: Journey complete
milestones.message: You finished strong. Keep practicing what works.

missions.title: Keep One Promise Today
missions.subtitle: Do what you said you would do—fully.
missions.whyThisMatters: Trust grows when your spouse sees your words match your actions.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one promise you made (big or small).
Do it today without reminders.
Then tell your spouse: “I did what I said I would do.”

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Start with something simple. Consistency builds confidence.

completionCard.title: You followed through
completionCard.message: Your actions matched your words today.

missions.title: Be Clear About Time
missions.subtitle: Give clear times instead of vague promises.
missions.whyThisMatters: Vague promises cause disappointment. Clear times reduce stress.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Today, when you make a plan, include a clear time.
Say: “I will do it by ___.”
If you are unsure, say: “I can’t promise yet. I will confirm by ___.”

completionCard.title: You became clear
completionCard.message: Clear timing makes your spouse feel safe.

missions.title: Update Before You’re Late
missions.subtitle: Don’t disappear. Communicate early.
missions.whyThisMatters: Late updates feel like disrespect. Early updates feel like care.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: If you will be late today, message or call before the time passes.
Say: “I’m running late. I will be home at ___.”
Then keep that new time.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Early updates build trust faster than apologies.

completionCard.title: You protected trust
completionCard.message: You communicated early and kept your spouse informed.

missions.title: Remove One Unreliable Habit
missions.subtitle: Stop one habit that makes you hard to trust.
missions.whyThisMatters: Trust grows when you remove what keeps breaking it.

cards.title: Choose your habit to stop
cards.prompt: Pick one habit you will stop for 7 days:
options: Saying yes when I can’t deliver.
Ignoring messages when I’m busy.
Changing plans without telling my spouse.
Making promises when I’m unsure.

cards.title: Tell your spouse
bullets: Say: “For 7 days, I will stop this habit.”
Ask: “Will you hold me to it?”

completionCard.title: You chose change
completionCard.message: Removing a weak point strengthens trust.

missions.title: Do One Small Follow-through Daily
missions.subtitle: Build trust with daily proof.
missions.whyThisMatters: Small consistent actions rebuild trust faster than big speeches.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one small task your spouse cares about (trash, dishes, call, pickup).
Do it without reminders.
Log your completion.

completionCard.title: You showed consistency
completionCard.message: Daily proof builds trust.

missions.title: Share Your Plan
missions.subtitle: Be open about your day.
missions.whyThisMatters: Transparency removes suspicion and reduces stress.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Tell your spouse your plan for the next 24 hours.
Include: where you’ll be, key times, and any changes.
If something changes, update early.

completionCard.title: You became predictable
completionCard.message: A clear plan helps your spouse relax.

missions.title: Ask What Builds Trust for Your Spouse
missions.subtitle: Let your spouse tell you what matters most.
missions.whyThisMatters: Trust is personal. This mission helps you focus on what your spouse values.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “What makes you feel you can trust me?”
Listen without defending.
Write down the top 2 things they say.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Don’t argue their answer. Receive it.

completionCard.title: You listened for what matters
completionCard.message: Now you know what trust looks like to your spouse.

missions.title: Fix One Broken Expectation
missions.subtitle: Make one clear correction this week.
missions.whyThisMatters: Fixing one broken expectation shows your spouse you take trust seriously.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “What’s one thing I said I would do but didn’t?”
Pick one item and complete it this week.
Tell your spouse when it’s done.

completionCard.title: You corrected course
completionCard.message: That correction is proof you are changing.

missions.title: Do a Weekly Check-in
missions.subtitle: Review your reliability together.
missions.whyThisMatters: A calm check-in prevents trust from silently eroding.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “How did I do this week with keeping my word?”
Listen fully.
Say: “Thank you. I will improve where I missed it.”

completionCard.title: You stayed accountable
completionCard.message: Accountability rebuilds trust.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit that makes you dependable.
missions.whyThisMatters: Your habit will speak louder than your apology.

cards.title: Choose your habit
cards.prompt: Pick one habit for your next 7 days:
options: I give clear times when I promise something.
I update early if plans change.
I do one small follow-through daily.

cards.title: Tell your spouse
bullets: Say: “For 7 days, I will do this. You will see it.”
Start today.

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You built a habit of reliability. Keep it going.

journeys.title: Restoring Friendship and Emotional Connection
journeys.summary: Missions to bring back laughter, warmth, and the feeling of being on the same team again.

milestones.title: Your streak starts
milestones.message: You started. Keep going tomorrow.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are building stronger connection in your home.

milestones.title: Journey complete
milestones.message: You showed up with love. Keep practicing.

missions.title: 15 Minutes, No Phones
missions.subtitle: Spend 15 minutes with your spouse with no phone and no problem talk.
missions.whyThisMatters: Friendship returns when you spend simple time together without tension or distractions.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Spend 15 minutes with your spouse today with no phones and no problem talk.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Put both phones out of reach.
Sit near your spouse (same couch/table/bed).
Rule: no complaints, no heavy topics, no fixing.
Talk about something light: your day, a funny story, a memory, a dream.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: If you drift into problems, smile and say: “Not now. Let’s keep it light.”

completionCard.title: You chose friendship
completionCard.message: That small time built warmth again.

missions.title: Share One Good Memory
missions.subtitle: Bring back a moment that reminds you why you chose each other.
missions.whyThisMatters: Good memories soften hearts and rebuild closeness when things feel cold.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Tell your spouse one good memory you love.
Say: “I still smile when I remember ______.”
Ask: “What’s one memory you love too?”
Listen.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Keep it simple. The goal is warmth, not perfection.

completionCard.title: You brought back warmth
completionCard.message: Memories remind your heart that love has history.

missions.title: Ask 3 Curiosity Questions
missions.subtitle: Learn something new about your spouse again.
missions.whyThisMatters: Curiosity brings friendship back. You can’t feel close to someone you stop knowing.

cards.title: Pick your 3 questions
cards.prompt: Ask your spouse any 3 questions:
options: What has been stressing you the most lately?
What do you miss from when we first got married?
What makes you feel loved this week?
What is one thing you want to improve in your life right now?
What is one thing you wish I understood better about you?

cards.title: Rule
bullets: Ask your question.
Listen fully.
Do not argue or correct.

completionCard.title: You chose curiosity
completionCard.message: Curiosity is a strong way to love.

missions.title: Send a 20-Second Appreciation
missions.subtitle: Appreciate your spouse out loud, not in your head.
missions.whyThisMatters: People feel loved when appreciation is spoken. This mission makes it real.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Tell your spouse one specific thing you appreciate today.
Use this line: “I appreciate you for ______.”
Keep it under 20 seconds.

cards.title: Examples
bullets: “I appreciate you for how you handle the kids.”
“I appreciate you for working hard for our home.”
“I appreciate you for staying patient with me.”

completionCard.title: You spoke life
completionCard.message: Your words added strength to your marriage today.

missions.title: Do One Small Helpful Act
missions.subtitle: Serve your spouse in a simple way today.
missions.whyThisMatters: Friendship grows when love becomes practical, not just feelings.

cards.title: Pick one act
cards.prompt: Do one small helpful act today:
options: Wash one thing your spouse usually washes.
Handle one small task your spouse dislikes.
Make tea/water/food for your spouse.
Give your spouse 10 minutes of quiet rest.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Do it quietly. Don’t demand credit.

completionCard.title: You served with love
completionCard.message: Small acts rebuild friendship fast.

missions.title: Laugh Together Once
missions.subtitle: Create one moment of laughter with your spouse.
missions.whyThisMatters: Laughter reduces stress and reminds you that you are friends, not enemies.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Send your spouse something funny (a short clip or meme).
Or tell a funny story from your day.
Your goal is one shared laugh.

cards.title: Keep it clean
cards.text: Keep it respectful and safe for your values.

completionCard.title: You brought joy
completionCard.message: Joy is part of a healthy marriage.

missions.title: Use Team Words
missions.subtitle: Replace “you vs me” with “we”.
missions.whyThisMatters: Team language changes the mood in your home. It reduces blame and builds unity.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: In one conversation today, use “we” on purpose.
Say one of these:
• “How can we handle this?”
• “Let’s figure this out together.”
• “We can get through this.”

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Even one “we” can soften a tense moment.

completionCard.title: You chose unity
completionCard.message: Team words build team hearts.

missions.title: Plan a Simple “Mini-Date”
missions.subtitle: A small plan can restart closeness.
missions.whyThisMatters: Friendship returns when you create moments on purpose.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Plan a simple 20-minute mini-date this week.
Pick one: a walk, a snack together, a short drive, a game, tea time.
Tell your spouse the time.
Keep it simple.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Don’t wait for “perfect time.” Choose a small time and do it.

completionCard.title: You made time
completionCard.message: Time together is where friendship grows.

missions.title: Start a Talk Softly
missions.subtitle: Start one request without a harsh tone.
missions.whyThisMatters: Many fights start with tone. A soft start keeps the door open.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one request you want to make.
Start with: “Can I ask you something?”
Then say: “It would help me if ______.”
Keep your voice low.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: If you feel hot inside, pause for 10 seconds before you start.

completionCard.title: You kept it gentle
completionCard.message: A gentle start prevents a harsh fight.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Friendship Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit that keeps your friendship alive.
missions.whyThisMatters: A habit turns a good moment into a new normal.

cards.title: Choose your habit
cards.prompt: Pick one habit for your next 7 days:
options: 15 minutes with no phones each day.
One spoken appreciation each day.
One curiosity question each day.

cards.title: Tell your spouse
bullets: Say: “For 7 days, I want us to try this.”
Start today.

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You rebuilt warmth and friendship. Keep it going.

journeys.title: Strengthening Emotional and Physical Intimacy
journeys.summary: Missions to build closeness, safety, and affection without pressure or awkwardness.

milestones.title: Your streak starts
milestones.message: You started. Keep going tomorrow.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are building closeness with care and respect.

milestones.title: Journey complete
milestones.message: You showed up with love. Keep practicing.

missions.title: Safe Touch, No Pressure
missions.subtitle: Give your spouse affection without expecting sex.
missions.whyThisMatters: Pressure kills intimacy. Safe touch builds it.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Give your spouse safe touch today without expecting anything back.

cards.title: Choose your touch
cards.prompt: Pick one:
options: Hug for 10 seconds.
Hold hands for 1 minute.
Sit close for 5 minutes.
Touch their shoulder and say something kind.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Your goal is safety, not pressure.

completionCard.title: You created safety
completionCard.message: Safe affection is a strong step toward closeness.

missions.title: Ask What Helps Your Spouse Feel Close
missions.subtitle: Let your spouse define closeness in their own words.
missions.whyThisMatters: Intimacy grows faster when you stop guessing and start asking.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “What helps you feel close to me?”
Listen fully.
Repeat back one sentence you heard.
Say: “Thank you. I will try that.”

completionCard.title: You learned what matters
completionCard.message: Now you know what closeness means to your spouse.

missions.title: Share One Emotional Need
missions.subtitle: Say one need clearly without blaming.
missions.whyThisMatters: Clear needs prevent silent resentment and bring you closer.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Say one sentence: “I need ______ from you.”
Keep it gentle and specific.
Then stop and listen.

cards.title: Examples
bullets: “I need 10 minutes of your attention after dinner.”
“I need a kind tone when we disagree.”

completionCard.title: You spoke clearly
completionCard.message: Clear needs build closeness faster than hints.

missions.title: Give One Respectful Compliment
missions.subtitle: Make your spouse feel wanted and valued.
missions.whyThisMatters: Affection grows when your spouse feels seen and desired in a respectful way.

cards.title: Choose your compliment
cards.prompt: Say one respectful compliment:
options: You look good today.
I love how you take care of our home.
I feel proud to be your spouse.
I feel safe with you when you speak kindly.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Say it with eye contact if you can.

completionCard.title: You built desire
completionCard.message: Respectful compliments feed intimacy.

missions.title: Create Your Touch Menu
missions.subtitle: Agree on what touch feels safe and good right now.
missions.whyThisMatters: A simple “menu” reduces awkwardness and increases safety.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask your spouse: “What touch feels good for you these days?”
Each of you list 3 safe touches (hug, kiss, cuddle, hand-hold, back rub).
Choose one touch you will do this week.

cards.title: Rule
cards.text: Respect ‘no’ without pushing. Safety builds desire.

completionCard.title: You made it easier
completionCard.message: A simple plan reduces pressure and increases closeness.

missions.title: Do a 3-Minute Emotional Check-in
missions.subtitle: Reconnect emotionally in a simple way.
missions.whyThisMatters: Emotional intimacy is the bridge to physical intimacy.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “How are you feeling today?”
Listen for 2 minutes.
Say: “Thank you. I’m here with you.”
Stop.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Keep it short. This is closeness, not counseling.

completionCard.title: You reconnected
completionCard.message: Short check-ins build emotional closeness.

missions.title: Remove Pressure With One Sentence
missions.subtitle: Say a sentence that makes your spouse feel safe.
missions.whyThisMatters: Pressure and fear kill intimacy. Safety and patience revive it.

cards.title: Say this
bullets: Say: “I won’t pressure you. I want us to feel close in a good way.”
Then ask: “What feels safe for you this week?”

completionCard.title: You built safety
completionCard.message: Safety is a powerful form of love.

missions.title: Plan One Closeness Moment
missions.subtitle: Plan a simple moment for connection this week.
missions.whyThisMatters: Planning removes uncertainty and increases follow-through.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Plan one closeness moment this week (a walk, cuddle time, tea time, date night).
Choose the day and time.
Tell your spouse.
Keep it realistic.

completionCard.title: You made time
completionCard.message: Closeness grows when you create space for it.

missions.title: End With Kindness
missions.subtitle: After closeness, add a simple kind moment.
missions.whyThisMatters: Kind endings build safety and make intimacy feel good, not stressful.

cards.title: Choose one
cards.prompt: After a hug/cuddle/date, do one:
options: Say “Thank you for being close to me.”
Pray one short sentence together.
Say one thing you enjoyed about the moment.

completionCard.title: You protected the moment
completionCard.message: Kind endings make closeness easier next time.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Closeness Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit that keeps intimacy growing.
missions.whyThisMatters: A small habit can restart closeness in a big way.

cards.title: Choose your habit
cards.prompt: Pick one habit for your next 7 days:
options: One safe touch each day (hug/hand-hold).
One spoken compliment each day.
One 3-minute emotional check-in each day.

cards.title: Tell your spouse
bullets: Say: “For 7 days, I want us to try this.”
Start today.

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You built closeness with care and respect. Keep going.

journeys.title: Aligning Roles and Expectations in Marriage
journeys.summary: Missions to stop silent expectations, reduce resentment, and agree on what you each need in your home.

milestones.title: Your streak starts
milestones.message: You started. Keep going tomorrow.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are replacing assumptions with clear agreements.

milestones.title: Journey complete
milestones.message: You showed up with love. Keep practicing.

missions.title: Say One Expectation Out Loud
missions.subtitle: Stop expecting your spouse to read your mind.
missions.whyThisMatters: Silent expectations create resentment. Clear expectations create peace.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Tell your spouse one expectation you have been holding silently.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Say: “I realize I expected ______, but I didn’t say it.”
Then say: “Can we talk about it?”
Keep your tone calm.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: This is not a fight. This is clarity.

completionCard.title: You chose clarity
completionCard.message: Clear expectations prevent silent resentment.

missions.title: Ask Your Spouse’s Expectation
missions.subtitle: Let your spouse name what they need too.
missions.whyThisMatters: Peace grows when both of you feel heard and considered.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “What is one thing you expect from me that I may not know?”
Listen.
Repeat back one sentence you heard.

completionCard.title: You listened well
completionCard.message: Now you know what your spouse needs from you.

missions.title: List Your Top 3 Responsibilities
missions.subtitle: Agree on who handles what in your home.
missions.whyThisMatters: Many couples fight because roles are unclear. Clarity reduces stress.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Each of you write 3 responsibilities you own right now.
Share your lists.
Circle one area that feels unfair.
Pick one change you can test this week.

completionCard.title: You made roles visible
completionCard.message: Visible roles reduce hidden resentment.

missions.title: Stop Scorekeeping for One Day
missions.subtitle: Serve without keeping count.
missions.whyThisMatters: Scorekeeping fuels bitterness. Serving with love builds peace.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: For one day, don’t say “I did this, you didn’t.”
If you feel it rising, pause and breathe once.
Do one helpful act without expecting payback.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: You can address fairness later calmly. Today is about removing heat.

completionCard.title: You lowered tension
completionCard.message: Removing scorekeeping protects your home.

missions.title: Make One Boundary and One Request
missions.subtitle: Say what you can’t do and what you can do.
missions.whyThisMatters: Healthy boundaries stop burnout. Clear requests stop resentment.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Say one boundary: “I can’t ______.”
Then say one request: “It would help me if you ______.”
Keep it calm and specific.

cards.title: Examples
bullets: “I can’t do bedtime alone every night. It would help me if you do it twice this week.”
“I can’t handle surprise guests. It would help me if we agree before inviting anyone.”

completionCard.title: You protected your peace
completionCard.message: Boundaries and requests make marriage practical.

missions.title: Reset One Unclear Expectation
missions.subtitle: Turn a vague expectation into a clear agreement.
missions.whyThisMatters: Vague expectations create disappointment. Agreements create stability.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one expectation like: “Help more,” “Be romantic,” “Be present.”
Ask: “What does that look like for you?”
Agree on one clear action for this week.

completionCard.title: You turned fog into clarity
completionCard.message: Clear actions prevent repeated conflict.

missions.title: Agree on a Decision Rule
missions.subtitle: Decide how you make decisions as a couple.
missions.whyThisMatters: Many fights are really about power. A simple rule reduces struggle.

cards.title: Choose your rule
cards.prompt: Pick one decision rule for your home:
options: Big decisions need both of us to agree.
If one of us feels uncomfortable, we pause and revisit.
We pray, then decide together.

cards.title: Say it out loud
bullets: Tell your spouse your chosen rule.
Agree to test it for 2 weeks.

completionCard.title: You reduced power struggles
completionCard.message: A clear rule keeps decisions peaceful.

missions.title: Do a 2-Minute Daily Check-in
missions.subtitle: Prevent resentment with a short check-in.
missions.whyThisMatters: Small check-ins stop small frustrations from becoming big fights.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “What do you need from me today?”
Answer: “What I need from you today is ______.”
Keep it under 2 minutes each.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: This is logistics + love. Keep it simple.

completionCard.title: You stayed aligned
completionCard.message: Short check-ins protect your peace.

missions.title: Do a Weekly Reset
missions.subtitle: Review what worked and what didn’t.
missions.whyThisMatters: A weekly reset keeps small issues from piling up.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “What worked well for us this week?”
Ask: “What should we adjust next week?”
Agree on one change.

completionCard.title: You adjusted together
completionCard.message: Review prevents resentment from building.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Agreement
missions.subtitle: Pick one agreement you will keep for 7 days.
missions.whyThisMatters: A clear agreement makes marriage feel lighter.

cards.title: Choose your agreement
cards.prompt: Pick one agreement for your next 7 days:
options: We do a 2-minute daily check-in.
We state expectations clearly instead of assuming.
We stop scorekeeping and talk calmly if we feel burdened.

cards.title: Tell your spouse
bullets: Say: “For 7 days, I want us to try this.”
Start today.

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You replaced assumptions with clear agreements. Keep going.

journeys.title: Managing Finances as a Team
journeys.summary: Missions to stop money tension, talk about finances calmly, and build a simple plan together.

milestones.title: Your streak starts
milestones.message: You started. Keep going tomorrow.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are building stronger teamwork in your home.

milestones.title: Journey complete
milestones.message: You finished strong. Keep practicing.

missions.title: Have One Honest Money Talk
missions.subtitle: Talk about money calmly for 10 minutes.
missions.whyThisMatters: Money fights often hide fear and shame. A calm talk builds teamwork and reduces stress.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Have a calm 10-minute money talk with your spouse today.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Set a 10-minute timer.
Start with: “I want us to be a team with money.”
Each of you answers: “What worries you most right now?”
No blaming. No insults. No past fights.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: If your tone gets hot, pause for 10 seconds and restart softly.

completionCard.title: You started teamwork
completionCard.message: A calm money talk is a big step toward peace.

missions.title: Name Your Biggest Money Stress
missions.subtitle: Say what is stressing you without attacking your spouse.
missions.whyThisMatters: Clarity reduces anxiety. When you name the stress, you can plan for it.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Say: “What is stressing me is ______.”
Then say: “What would help me is ______.”
Listen to your spouse’s answer too.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Talk about the problem, not your spouse’s character.

completionCard.title: You brought clarity
completionCard.message: Naming the stress made it easier to face together.

missions.title: Check One Spending Category
missions.subtitle: Look at one category without shame.
missions.whyThisMatters: Small reviews prevent big surprises and reduce suspicion.

cards.title: Pick a category
cards.prompt: Pick one category to review for the last 7 days:
options: Food
Transport
Data/Airtime
Subscriptions
Impulse buying

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Open your bank app or notes.
Estimate how much you spent.
Say: “This surprised me: ______.”
Do not shame each other.

completionCard.title: You faced it
completionCard.message: Looking at one category reduces money anxiety.

missions.title: Agree on One Money Rule
missions.subtitle: Create one simple rule that reduces fights.
missions.whyThisMatters: Rules prevent repeated arguments and create predictability.

cards.title: Choose your rule
cards.prompt: Pick one rule for this month:
options: Any spending above ₦____ must be discussed first.
We do a 10-minute money check-in every week.
We don’t hide purchases from each other.
We stop lending money without agreement.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Choose one rule together.
Say: “We are doing this to protect our peace.”

completionCard.title: You created peace
completionCard.message: A clear rule reduces repeated fights.

missions.title: Set One Savings Target
missions.subtitle: Pick a small target you can hit together.
missions.whyThisMatters: Targets make progress visible and motivating.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one saving target for this month.
Decide the amount and where it will go.
Say: “We can do this together.”

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Small consistent saving beats big inconsistent saving.

completionCard.title: You set a goal
completionCard.message: A shared goal builds unity.

missions.title: Reduce One Money Leak
missions.subtitle: Cut one small thing for 7 days.
missions.whyThisMatters: A small sacrifice builds discipline and frees money for what matters.

cards.title: Choose your cut
cards.prompt: Pick one to reduce for 7 days:
options: Eating out
Impulse snacks
Unplanned rides
Extra subscriptions
Random online shopping

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Agree on the cut.
Replace it with a cheaper option.
Track your win each day.

completionCard.title: You built discipline
completionCard.message: Small discipline reduces money stress.

missions.title: Be Transparent About One Thing
missions.subtitle: Share one money detail you usually avoid.
missions.whyThisMatters: Transparency builds trust and reduces suspicion.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Share one detail you often avoid (a debt, a subscription, a family request).
Say: “I want us to be open, not ashamed.”
Ask: “How should we handle this together?”

completionCard.title: You chose honesty
completionCard.message: Honesty builds trust in money matters.

missions.title: Plan Next Week’s Money
missions.subtitle: Avoid stress by planning ahead.
missions.whyThisMatters: Planning reduces emergency spending and arguments.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: List your next week’s key expenses (food, transport, school, bills).
Agree on what comes first.
Decide who handles what.

completionCard.title: You reduced surprises
completionCard.message: A simple plan protects your peace.

missions.title: Do a Weekly Money Check-in
missions.subtitle: Keep it short and calm.
missions.whyThisMatters: A weekly check-in prevents small issues from becoming big fights.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Set 8 minutes.
Ask: “How did we do this week?”
Ask: “What should we adjust next week?”
Agree on one adjustment.

completionCard.title: You stayed aligned
completionCard.message: Short check-ins keep finances peaceful.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Money Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit that reduces tension.
missions.whyThisMatters: A simple habit turns money talk into teamwork.

cards.title: Choose your habit
cards.prompt: Pick one habit for your next 7 days:
options: A 5-minute daily money update.
No hiding purchases from each other.
A 10-minute weekly money check-in.

cards.title: Tell your spouse
bullets: Say: “For 7 days, I want us to try this.”
Start today.

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You built a money habit that protects your peace.

journeys.title: Parenting as a United Front
journeys.summary: Missions to stop mixed signals, protect your child(ren) from conflict, and parent as one team.

milestones.title: Your streak starts
milestones.message: You started. Keep going tomorrow.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are becoming a united team for your child(ren).

milestones.title: Journey complete
milestones.message: You finished strong. Keep practicing.

missions.title: Agree Before You Correct
missions.subtitle: Do not correct your child(ren) until you align with your spouse.
missions.whyThisMatters: When parents disagree in front of child(ren), children feel unsafe and parents feel disrespected.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Before correcting your child(ren) today, align with your spouse first.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: If an issue comes up, pause and say: “Let’s talk for 2 minutes first.”
Step aside privately.
Agree on the response.
Then speak to your child(ren) with one voice.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Unity first. Correction second.

completionCard.title: You protected unity
completionCard.message: That alignment made your home feel safer.

missions.title: Do Not Undermine Your Spouse
missions.subtitle: Support your spouse in front of your child(ren).
missions.whyThisMatters: Undermining breaks trust and confuses your child(ren).

cards.title: Steps
bullets: If you disagree with your spouse, do not correct them in front of your child(ren).
Say: “We will talk about it privately.”
Later, discuss calmly.

completionCard.title: You stayed united
completionCard.message: Your child(ren) saw one team, not two sides.

missions.title: Agree on One Rule
missions.subtitle: Pick one rule and apply it consistently.
missions.whyThisMatters: Inconsistent rules create rebellion and stress. One clear rule brings order.

cards.title: Pick one rule
cards.prompt: Choose one rule to enforce together:
options: Bedtime time
Screen time limit
Homework before play
No shouting in the house
No hitting

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Agree on the rule together.
Explain it to your child(ren) calmly.
Follow through consistently.

completionCard.title: You created clarity
completionCard.message: Consistency reduces stress for everyone.

missions.title: Have a Private Parent Talk
missions.subtitle: Talk as parents without blame.
missions.whyThisMatters: Many parenting fights are really marriage fights. Private parent talks keep things clean.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Set 10 minutes privately.
Each person answers: “What is hard for you right now?”
Then: “What would help you?”
Pick one change to test this week.

completionCard.title: You stayed calm
completionCard.message: A private talk prevents public conflict.

missions.title: Use One Consistent Consequence
missions.subtitle: Agree on a consequence you both will enforce.
missions.whyThisMatters: When consequences change, child(ren) test limits more.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one behavior you want to reduce.
Choose one consequence you both agree on (loss of screen time, early bedtime, extra chore).
Apply it consistently.

completionCard.title: You stayed consistent
completionCard.message: Consistency is a gift to your child(ren).

missions.title: Praise Your Child(ren) Together
missions.subtitle: Celebrate good behavior as a team.
missions.whyThisMatters: Praise builds more change than shouting.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one thing your child(ren) did well today.
Both of you praise it.
Keep it simple: “I’m proud of you for ______.”

completionCard.title: You built confidence
completionCard.message: Praise makes your home feel safe.

missions.title: No Fighting in Front of Your Child(ren)
missions.subtitle: Protect your child(ren) from adult conflict.
missions.whyThisMatters: Child(ren) carry the weight of what they see. Protecting them protects your home.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: If you feel conflict rising, stop.
Say: “Not in front of the kids. We’ll talk later.”
Step away and return to the issue privately.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: This is about safety, not avoidance.

completionCard.title: You protected your child(ren)
completionCard.message: That boundary is love.

missions.title: Do a 10-Minute Family Meeting
missions.subtitle: Create structure and calm.
missions.whyThisMatters: Family meetings reduce chaos and build cooperation.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Gather your family for 10 minutes.
Each person says one good thing from the day.
Parents state one focus for the week.
End with one short prayer or blessing.

completionCard.title: You created stability
completionCard.message: Structure makes family life calmer.

missions.title: Do a Parenting Reset
missions.subtitle: Review what is working and adjust one thing.
missions.whyThisMatters: Small adjustments prevent long-term frustration.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “What is working with our child(ren)?”
Ask: “What is not working?”
Agree on one change to test next week.

completionCard.title: You adjusted as a team
completionCard.message: Teamwork reduces parenting stress.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Parenting Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit that keeps you united.
missions.whyThisMatters: A simple habit keeps unity strong under stress.

cards.title: Choose your habit
cards.prompt: Pick one habit for your next 7 days:
options: We align privately before correcting our child(ren).
We praise our child(ren) once each day.
We never fight in front of our child(ren).

cards.title: Tell your spouse
bullets: Say: “For 7 days, let’s do this as a team.”
Start today.

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You built unity that protects your child(ren).

journeys.title: Healthy Boundaries With Extended Family
journeys.summary: Missions to protect your marriage, stop outside interference, and stay united with your spouse.

milestones.title: Your streak starts
milestones.message: You started. Keep going tomorrow.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are building stronger teamwork in your home.

milestones.title: Journey complete
milestones.message: You finished strong. Keep practicing.

missions.title: Say “We Will Decide Together”
missions.subtitle: Set a united boundary with one sentence.
missions.whyThisMatters: Many marriages suffer because family members feel entitled. Unity protects your home.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Today, use the sentence “We will decide together” when family pressure shows up.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Agree with your spouse first.
If someone pushes, say calmly: “We will decide together.”
Do not explain too much.
Repeat if needed.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Short answers work better than long arguments.

completionCard.title: You protected your marriage
completionCard.message: That one sentence built unity.

missions.title: Identify Your Biggest Pressure Point
missions.subtitle: Name what triggers family tension.
missions.whyThisMatters: You can’t set a boundary if you don’t know where pressure hits most.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Tell your spouse: “The biggest family pressure for me is ______.”
Name the person or situation (money, visits, disrespect, decisions).
Agree on what you want to protect.

completionCard.title: You named the problem
completionCard.message: Clarity helps you set stronger boundaries.

missions.title: Set One Boundary Rule
missions.subtitle: Create one clear rule for your home.
missions.whyThisMatters: Rules prevent repeated fights and confusion.

cards.title: Choose your rule
cards.prompt: Pick one boundary rule:
options: No surprise visits.
No money given without agreement.
No insults or disrespect tolerated.
We don’t discuss private marriage issues with family.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Agree as a couple.
Say: “This protects our home.”

completionCard.title: You created a rule
completionCard.message: A clear rule protects your peace.

missions.title: Support Your Spouse Publicly
missions.subtitle: Do not throw your spouse under the bus.
missions.whyThisMatters: When family sees division, they push harder. Public unity reduces interference.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: In front of family, back your spouse’s decision.
If you disagree, say: “We will talk about it privately.”
Discuss later calmly.

completionCard.title: You stayed united
completionCard.message: Unity is your boundary.

missions.title: Stop Triangles
missions.subtitle: Don’t let family turn you against each other.
missions.whyThisMatters: Triangulation destroys marriages slowly. This mission stops it.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: If family complains about your spouse to you, say:
“Please talk to us together.”
Do not carry messages back and forth.
Tell your spouse what happened calmly.

completionCard.title: You blocked division
completionCard.message: You protected your unity.

missions.title: Handle Guilt Without Giving In
missions.subtitle: Expect guilt. Don’t let it control you.
missions.whyThisMatters: Guilt makes you betray your spouse quietly. Strength protects your home.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: When you feel guilt, pause and breathe.
Say to yourself: “Protecting my marriage is not wicked.”
Stick to your boundary calmly.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Respect is not the same as control. You can respect family and still lead your home.

completionCard.title: You stayed strong
completionCard.message: You chose your home over pressure.

missions.title: Send One Clear Boundary Message
missions.subtitle: Communicate your boundary in a respectful way.
missions.whyThisMatters: Clear messages prevent repeated drama.

cards.title: Pick your message
cards.prompt: Send or say one of these:
options: We will let you know before you visit.
We cannot lend money right now.
Please speak respectfully. We won’t continue if there is disrespect.
We keep marriage matters private.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Keep it short. No long explanations.

completionCard.title: You made it clear
completionCard.message: Clarity reduces drama.

missions.title: Use Your Unity Phrase
missions.subtitle: Practice one phrase that keeps you aligned.
missions.whyThisMatters: A simple phrase stops arguments before they grow.

cards.title: Choose your phrase
cards.prompt: Pick one phrase you will use this week:
options: Let me speak with my spouse first.
We will decide together.
We will get back to you.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Use your phrase once this week.
Stay calm and repeat if needed.

completionCard.title: You stayed aligned
completionCard.message: That phrase protected your unity.

missions.title: Review Your Boundary Together
missions.subtitle: Check what worked and what needs adjusting.
missions.whyThisMatters: Review prevents resentment and improves your boundary over time.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “What boundary worked?”
Ask: “What needs to change?”
Agree on one adjustment.

completionCard.title: You improved your boundary
completionCard.message: Review makes your marriage stronger.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Boundary Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit that keeps your marriage protected.
missions.whyThisMatters: A habit keeps boundaries strong, even when pressure returns.

cards.title: Choose your habit
cards.prompt: Pick one habit for your next 7 days:
options: We don’t make family decisions without agreement.
We use our unity phrase under pressure.
We keep marriage matters private.

cards.title: Tell your spouse
bullets: Say: “For 7 days, let’s protect our marriage like this.”
Start today.

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You strengthened your boundaries and unity. Keep going.

journeys.title: Faith and Spiritual Unity
journeys.summary: Missions to pray together, reduce spiritual tension, and build unity without pressure or judgment.

milestones.title: Your streak starts
milestones.message: You started. Keep going tomorrow.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are building faith and maturity in your home.

milestones.title: Journey complete
milestones.message: You finished strong. Keep practicing.

missions.title: Pray One Sentence Together
missions.subtitle: A simple prayer with your spouse—no long talk.
missions.whyThisMatters: Spiritual unity grows through small consistent moments, not long sermons.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Pray one short sentence with your spouse today.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Sit near your spouse.
Hold hands if possible.
Pray one sentence like: “God, give us peace and love today.”
Stop. Smile. Continue your day.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Keep it simple. The goal is unity, not performance.

completionCard.title: You invited God in
completionCard.message: One short prayer can shift the atmosphere in your home.

missions.title: Share One Spiritual Struggle
missions.subtitle: Be honest without shame or judgment.
missions.whyThisMatters: Honesty builds spiritual safety. Pretending creates distance.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Tell your spouse one thing you’ve been struggling with spiritually.
Use: “I’ve been struggling with ______.”
Then ask: “Can you pray for me this week?”

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Do not correct your spouse’s struggle. Support it.

completionCard.title: You built spiritual safety
completionCard.message: Honesty makes unity easier.

missions.title: Read One Verse Together
missions.subtitle: One verse. One takeaway. Done.
missions.whyThisMatters: Scripture shared simply can strengthen your marriage without pressure.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one verse (you can use the app’s verse suggestion).
Read it out loud.
Each person says one short takeaway: “This reminds me ______.”

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Keep your takeaway to one sentence.

completionCard.title: You fed your spirit
completionCard.message: Small scripture moments build unity over time.

missions.title: Speak a Blessing Over Your Spouse
missions.subtitle: Say one blessing out loud.
missions.whyThisMatters: Blessings build respect and tenderness in your marriage.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Say one blessing out loud to your spouse.
Use: “I bless you with ______.”
Examples: peace, strength, wisdom, joy, favor.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Say it with eye contact if you can.

completionCard.title: You spoke life
completionCard.message: Blessings soften hearts and build love.

missions.title: Invite God Into One Hard Topic
missions.subtitle: Pray before you discuss one difficult topic.
missions.whyThisMatters: Prayer reduces pride and increases calm. It helps you talk with humility.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Choose one hard topic (money, intimacy, family, parenting).
Pray one sentence first: “God, help us talk with love.”
Then discuss calmly for 10 minutes.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: If your voices rise, pause and pray again.

completionCard.title: You chose humility
completionCard.message: Prayer before talk reduces fights.

missions.title: Respect Your Spouse’s Spiritual Pace
missions.subtitle: Do not pressure. Do not mock. Support.
missions.whyThisMatters: Pressure creates resistance. Respect makes faith feel safe.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “What helps you spiritually, and what doesn’t?”
Listen without correcting.
Say: “I respect your pace. I’m with you.”

completionCard.title: You chose respect
completionCard.message: Respect builds unity faster than pressure.

missions.title: Forgive One Small Offense
missions.subtitle: Drop one small hurt today.
missions.whyThisMatters: Unforgiveness builds heaviness in your home. Letting go builds peace.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Choose one small offense from today.
Say: “I forgive you for that.”
Then do one reconnection: hug or hold hands.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Forgiveness is a decision. Feelings may follow later.

completionCard.title: You chose peace
completionCard.message: Forgiveness lifts weight from your home.

missions.title: Pray for Your Home
missions.subtitle: Pray a short prayer for your marriage and home.
missions.whyThisMatters: Covering your home in prayer brings calm and direction.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pray one short prayer for your home.
Mention: peace, love, wisdom, protection.
End with: “God, help us.”

completionCard.title: You covered your home
completionCard.message: Prayer strengthens your foundation.

missions.title: Talk About Your Faith Goals
missions.subtitle: Agree on one spiritual goal as a couple.
missions.whyThisMatters: A simple goal keeps you aligned and reduces spiritual drift.

cards.title: Pick one goal
cards.prompt: Choose one goal for this month:
options: Pray together 3 times this week.
Read one verse together weekly.
Attend church together consistently.
Do one act of kindness together weekly.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one goal together.
Choose the day(s).
Keep it realistic.

completionCard.title: You set direction
completionCard.message: A shared goal builds unity.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Faith Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit you will do for 7 days.
missions.whyThisMatters: Small faith habits create big unity over time.

cards.title: Choose your habit
cards.prompt: Pick one habit for your next 7 days:
options: One short prayer together each day.
One blessing spoken each day.
One verse read together each day.

cards.title: Tell your spouse
bullets: Say: “For 7 days, let’s do this together.”
Start today.

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You built spiritual unity. Keep going.

journeys.title: Personal Growth and Emotional Maturity in Marriage
journeys.summary: Missions to build self-control, take responsibility, and grow without blaming your spouse.

milestones.title: Your streak starts
milestones.message: You started. Keep going tomorrow.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are building faith and maturity in your home.

milestones.title: Journey complete
milestones.message: You finished strong. Keep practicing.

missions.title: Take Responsibility Without Excuses
missions.subtitle: Own one mistake without defending yourself.
missions.whyThisMatters: Mature love owns mistakes. Excuses keep conflict alive.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Today, own one mistake without excuses.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Say one sentence: “I was wrong for ______.”
Stop.
Ask: “How can I make it better?”

cards.title: Rule
cards.text: No “but”. No “if you”. No defending.

completionCard.title: You chose maturity
completionCard.message: Owning your mistake lowered the tension.

missions.title: Stay Calm Under Feedback
missions.subtitle: Hear feedback without reacting.
missions.whyThisMatters: Your spouse can’t speak honestly if you explode. Calm builds safety.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “What is one thing I should improve?”
Listen fully.
Say: “Thank you. I hear you.”
Do not argue.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: If you feel hot inside, breathe slowly and keep listening.

completionCard.title: You stayed calm
completionCard.message: Calm listening is emotional strength.

missions.title: Delay Your Reaction
missions.subtitle: Pause before you respond when you feel triggered.
missions.whyThisMatters: Fast reactions create regret. Delayed reactions create wisdom.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: When you feel triggered today, pause for 10 seconds.
Say: “Give me a minute. I want to respond well.”
Then respond calmly.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Your pause is your power.

completionCard.title: You gained control
completionCard.message: That pause protected your words.

missions.title: Do One Hard Thing
missions.subtitle: Do the right thing even if you don’t feel like it.
missions.whyThisMatters: Maturity is doing what is right, not what is easy.

cards.title: Pick one hard thing
cards.prompt: Choose one hard thing to do today:
options: Apologize first.
Speak calmly instead of snapping.
Follow through on a promise.
Stop arguing and listen.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Do it once today. That’s your win.

completionCard.title: You built strength
completionCard.message: You chose what is right over what is easy.

missions.title: Manage Your Emotion in the Moment
missions.subtitle: Calm your body before you speak.
missions.whyThisMatters: When your body calms down, your words follow.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: When you feel hot inside, take 3 slow breaths.
Relax your shoulders.
Then speak in a low voice.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Lower voice = lower fight.

completionCard.title: You calmed yourself
completionCard.message: You led your emotions instead of being led by them.

missions.title: Keep Your Word Today
missions.subtitle: Do what you said you would do.
missions.whyThisMatters: Reliability is maturity. It builds trust fast.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one promise you made.
Do it today without reminders.
Tell your spouse: “I did it.”

completionCard.title: You showed reliability
completionCard.message: Your actions built trust today.

missions.title: Remove One Blame Sentence
missions.subtitle: Replace blame with a need.
missions.whyThisMatters: Blame creates defense. Needs create clarity.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Catch one blame sentence you usually say.
Say it again as a need: “I need ______.”
Keep it calm.

completionCard.title: You became clearer
completionCard.message: You asked for what you need without attacking.

missions.title: Practice Patience Once
missions.subtitle: Choose patience in one moment you usually react.
missions.whyThisMatters: Patience is a sign of strength. It protects your home.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: In one frustrating moment today, choose patience.
Say: “It’s okay. I can wait.”
Keep your voice calm.

completionCard.title: You chose patience
completionCard.message: That patience protected your relationship.

missions.title: Apply One Lesson Immediately
missions.subtitle: Turn insight into action today.
missions.whyThisMatters: Growth is not knowledge. Growth is action.

cards.title: Pick one action
cards.prompt: Pick one growth action today:
options: Apologize quickly if you hurt your spouse.
Lower your voice when you feel tense.
Ask one helpful question instead of defending.
Reconnect before bed if there is tension.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Do it once today. That’s progress.

completionCard.title: You acted on growth
completionCard.message: You turned intention into action.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Maturity Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit you will practice for 7 days.
missions.whyThisMatters: Small daily habits build big maturity.

cards.title: Choose your habit
cards.prompt: Pick one habit for your next 7 days:
options: I pause before I respond when tense.
I own my mistakes quickly with no excuses.
I replace blame with clear needs.

cards.title: Tell your spouse
bullets: Say: “For 7 days, I’m practicing this.”
Start today.

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You practiced maturity with consistency. Keep going.

journeys.title: Building Shared Purpose and Vision
journeys.summary: Missions to align your priorities, agree on your direction, and build a shared future as a team.

milestones.title: Your streak starts
milestones.message: You started. Keep going tomorrow.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are building faith and maturity in your home.

milestones.title: Journey complete
milestones.message: You finished strong. Keep practicing.

missions.title: Talk About Your Future
missions.subtitle: Have a 10-minute future talk with your spouse.
missions.whyThisMatters: Couples drift when they stop talking about direction. A short talk brings alignment.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Have a 10-minute future talk with your spouse today.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Set 10 minutes.
Ask: “What do you want our next year to look like?”
Each person shares 2 things.
Listen. No arguing.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: This is alignment, not a debate.

completionCard.title: You created direction
completionCard.message: That short talk reduced drift.

missions.title: Share Your Personal Goal
missions.subtitle: Let your spouse know what you’re chasing.
missions.whyThisMatters: Support grows when your spouse knows what matters to you.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Tell your spouse one goal you have.
Use: “One goal I have is ______.”
Ask: “How can we support each other?”

completionCard.title: You invited support
completionCard.message: Clarity brings teamwork.

missions.title: Align Your Top Priorities
missions.subtitle: Choose what matters most as a couple.
missions.whyThisMatters: Many conflicts come from competing priorities. Alignment reduces tension.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Each of you list your top 3 priorities right now.
Compare your lists.
Circle one mismatch.
Agree on one adjustment for this month.

completionCard.title: You aligned priorities
completionCard.message: Shared priorities reduce conflict.

missions.title: Identify Your Shared Values
missions.subtitle: Name what you want your home to stand for.
missions.whyThisMatters: Values guide decisions when life is stressful.

cards.title: Pick your values
cards.prompt: Choose 3 values for your home:
options: Peace
Respect
Faith
Honesty
Kindness
Discipline
Generosity

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Choose 3 values together.
Say: “This is what our home stands for.”

completionCard.title: You set your foundation
completionCard.message: Values make decisions easier.

missions.title: Remove One Competing Agenda
missions.subtitle: Stop one thing that pulls you apart.
missions.whyThisMatters: Competing agendas create silent conflict. Removing one brings unity.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Name one thing pulling you apart (overwork, phones, friends, family pressure).
Agree on one small change this week.
Example: phone-free dinners, earlier bedtime, one date.

completionCard.title: You reduced division
completionCard.message: That change created more unity.

missions.title: Pray for Your Direction
missions.subtitle: Pray for your marriage’s direction.
missions.whyThisMatters: Prayer brings humility and guidance when you need decisions.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pray one short prayer for direction.
Say: “God, lead our home.”
Keep it simple.

completionCard.title: You sought guidance
completionCard.message: Seeking God together builds unity.

missions.title: Set One Shared Goal
missions.subtitle: Choose one goal you will chase together.
missions.whyThisMatters: A shared goal turns you into teammates.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one shared goal (saving, prayer, date nights, parenting, fitness).
Make it specific: how often, how much, by when.
Write it down.

completionCard.title: You became teammates
completionCard.message: A shared goal builds teamwork.

missions.title: Encourage Your Spouse’s Dream
missions.subtitle: Support your spouse out loud.
missions.whyThisMatters: Encouragement builds friendship and reduces competition.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Tell your spouse: “I believe in you for ______.”
Ask: “What support do you need from me?”
Choose one small support action.

completionCard.title: You strengthened your spouse
completionCard.message: Support makes marriage feel safe and strong.

missions.title: Review Your Progress
missions.subtitle: Check what is working and adjust.
missions.whyThisMatters: Review keeps goals alive and prevents drift.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask: “What improved for us this month?”
Ask: “What should we adjust?”
Agree on one adjustment.

completionCard.title: You stayed intentional
completionCard.message: Review keeps purpose alive.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Purpose Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit that keeps you aligned.
missions.whyThisMatters: A small habit prevents drift.

cards.title: Choose your habit
cards.prompt: Pick one habit for your next 7 days:
options: One 10-minute future talk each week.
One prayer for direction each day.
One shared goal check-in each week.

cards.title: Tell your spouse
bullets: Say: “For 7 days, let’s stay aligned like this.”
Start today.

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You built alignment and shared direction. Keep going.

journeys.title: Communication and Conflict Resolution
journeys.summary: Simple missions to help you talk without snapping, listen without interrupting, and handle disagreements without repeating the same fight.

milestones.title: Your streak starts
milestones.message: You took your first step. Keep going tomorrow.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are building calmer conversations.

milestones.title: Journey complete
milestones.message: You are becoming someone who speaks with wisdom and listens with love.

missions.title: Pause Before You Speak
missions.subtitle: Do a 10‑second pause before you reply when you feel tense.
missions.whyThisMatters: Most damage happens in your first quick reply. A short pause protects your words and your tone.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Today, when you feel tense, pause for 10 seconds before you reply.

cards.title: How to do it
bullets: When you feel tense, count slowly in your head: 1 to 10.
After your pause, say one calm line from the list.
Do this once today to pass.

cards.title: Pick your calm line
cards.prompt: Choose one line you will say after your pause:
options: Okay. I hear you.
Give me a minute. I want to respond well.
Let me think first.

cards.title: Quick tip
cards.text: If you forget, it’s okay. Try again at the next tense moment.

completionCard.title: You chose self-control
completionCard.message: That pause gave your words time to cool down.

missions.title: Let Your Spouse Finish
missions.subtitle: Listen without interrupting for one full story.
missions.whyThisMatters: Interrupting makes your spouse feel ignored. Letting them finish builds safety.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Ask your spouse one question and let them finish without you cutting in.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Sit near your spouse. Put your phone away.
Ask: “How was your day, really?”
While they talk: don’t interrupt, don’t correct, don’t give solutions.
When they finish, say: “Thanks for telling me. I’m listening.”

cards.title: Make it easy
cards.text: If you want to interrupt, press your tongue to the roof of your mouth and breathe once.

completionCard.title: You made space for your spouse
completionCard.message: Listening without interruption is love in action.

missions.title: Repeat Back What You Heard
missions.subtitle: Say it back in your spouse’s words before you respond.
missions.whyThisMatters: When your spouse feels understood, your conversation gets calmer fast.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Ask your spouse: “What’s one thing on your mind right now?”
When they finish, say: “So you’re saying ______.”
Then ask: “Did I get that right?”
If they say “not exactly”, say: “Okay—say it again. I want to understand.”

cards.title: Keep it simple
cards.text: Don’t add your opinion yet. Your job is to get it right first.

completionCard.title: You listened to understand
completionCard.message: That simple repeat-back reduces fights and builds trust.

missions.title: Own One Thing
missions.subtitle: Admit one fault in one sentence—no excuses.
missions.whyThisMatters: Many fights continue because nobody admits anything. Humility ends cycles.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: After a tense moment, say one sentence that starts with:
• “You’re right—I ______.” OR “I shouldn’t have ______.”
Stop after one sentence. Don’t explain.

cards.title: Examples
bullets: “You’re right—I raised my voice.”
“I shouldn’t have ignored you.”
“You’re right—I came off dismissive.”

completionCard.title: You chose humility
completionCard.message: Owning your part lowers the heat in your home.

missions.title: Ask One Helpful Question
missions.subtitle: Ask instead of defending yourself.
missions.whyThisMatters: Defending keeps the fight alive. A helpful question calms it down.

cards.title: Choose your question
cards.prompt: Next time your spouse complains, ask one of these:
options: What would have helped you in that moment?
What do you need from me right now?
What part hurt the most?

cards.title: Rule
bullets: Ask one question.
Then listen.
Don’t explain or argue.

completionCard.title: You chose understanding
completionCard.message: That question opened a door instead of starting a war.

missions.title: Fix Your Tone
missions.subtitle: Say it again in a kinder way—right away.
missions.whyThisMatters: Your words can be right and your tone can still hurt. Fixing your tone builds respect.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: When you notice you sound harsh, stop.
Say: “Let me say that again in a better way.”
Repeat your sentence more gently.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: If your spouse looks hurt, that’s your sign to redo your tone.

completionCard.title: You protected your respect
completionCard.message: You chose kindness in the moment it mattered.

missions.title: Stay Present
missions.subtitle: Stay in the conversation for 3 minutes instead of shutting down.
missions.whyThisMatters: Shutting down feels safe, but it leaves your spouse alone. Staying present builds closeness.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: When the conversation gets uncomfortable, don’t walk away.
Breathe slowly and stay for 3 minutes.
If you need a break, say: “I need 10 minutes, but I will come back.”

cards.title: Use a timer
cards.text: Set a 3‑minute timer. Your goal is to stay, not to win.

completionCard.title: You stayed when it was hard
completionCard.message: That is strength. That is love.

missions.title: Talk About One Thing Only
missions.subtitle: Have a 5‑minute talk that stays on one topic.
missions.whyThisMatters: Many fights explode because one issue becomes seven issues. One topic keeps your talk safe.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one topic: money, chores, intimacy, time, in‑laws, parenting.
Set a 5‑minute timer.
Rule: no past issues, no insults, no extra topics.
Each person says: “What I feel is ___.” then “What I need is ___.”

cards.title: Rule
cards.text: If you start another topic, pause and return to your one topic.

completionCard.title: You kept it safe
completionCard.message: One topic. Calm words. That’s how you win conflict.

missions.title: Reconnect Before You Sleep
missions.subtitle: Don’t carry tension into tomorrow.
missions.whyThisMatters: Silence for days breaks closeness. A small reconnection keeps your home safe.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Before bed, say: “I don’t want us to sleep in coldness. Can we clear this?”
Then do one simple ending:
• Hug for 10 seconds OR hold hands for 30 seconds.
Optional: pray one sentence: “God, bring peace to our home.”

cards.title: Keep it short
cards.text: You’re not solving everything tonight. You’re choosing peace.

completionCard.title: You chose peace
completionCard.message: Small reconnections protect your marriage.

missions.title: Choose Your 7‑Day Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit and do it for 7 days.
missions.whyThisMatters: A one-time win feels good. A habit changes your home.

cards.title: Choose your habit
cards.prompt: Pick one habit for your next 7 days:
options: We pause 10 seconds before we reply when tense.
We repeat back what we heard once each day.
We reconnect before sleep if there is tension.

cards.title: Tell your spouse
bullets: Say: “For 7 days, I want us to try this.”
Keep it simple. Start today.

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You are becoming someone who speaks with wisdom and listens with love.
